header: new issue-wal-mart sells 100 bln yen of samurai bonds
wal-mart sells 100 bln yen in samurai bonds - lead
body:
TOKYO, July 21 (Reuters) - Wal-Mart Stores Inc (WMT.N) sold 100 billion yen ($1.14 billion) of Samurai bonds in three tranches, lead manager Mizuho Securities said on Wednesday.

Wal-Mart, the world’s biggest retailer, sold 60 billion yen in five-year fixed-rate bonds, 30 billion yen in five-year floating-rate bonds and 10 billion yen in 10-year fixed-rate bonds.

The coupon for the five-year fixed-rate bonds is set at 30 basis points above yen swaps, while that for the five-year floating-rate bonds is set 45 basis points above three-month yen Libor.

The coupon of the 10-year bonds is set at 40 basis points above yen swaps.

Merrill Lynch Japan Securities and Mitsubishi UFJ Morgan Stanley Securities are other lead managers

Samurai bonds are yen bonds issued in Japan by non-Japanese entities. (Reporting by Rika Otsuka; Editing by Charlotte Cooper)
